reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read Frommer's glowing review of the the Step Back Inn, we booked it on the road without a second thought. At the time we really needed to stop for the night while exploring the Northwest corner of New Mexico. But while the reviewer found "Victorian charm", plate-sized danishes and interesting local history booklets, we found a mediocre-to-good motel experience barely surpassing the budget chains. The differences in opinion may be because the reviewer is a native of New Mexico. Could the mere inclusion of wallpaper have been enough to send her over the edge? Sure enough, it was practically the only wallpaper sighted in nearly 10 days of travel, so we can see why it might arouse curiosity and admiration.To us New Englanders, the vinyl-coated wallpaper seemed dingy and non-descript. It might have helped had they papered all four walls. The local history booklets were perfunctory at best and dog-eared. The reviewer also praised the Inn because it is an architect designed building, but again we were mystified. Folks, this is a box!
reviews.title: This Victorian Seems Like A Crabby Aunt
My Manager Loved His Stay
reviews.text: True, they do provide frilly curtains in the bathroom, but the curtains decorate the shower enclosure and a closet which has all the charm of a department store dressing room, and worst of all......no tub. That is so not Victorian.

reviews.title: A great place to stay, wonderful experience.
reviews.text: The final straw was finding a printed placard in our sparsely furnished room nagging us about how, if we want to use a rag, to please ask for one at the front desk, rather than use their towels in place of rags. People may occasionally, wrongly, use towels for rags, but is it worth printing up reminders and posting them in every room?

After calling and trying to book a room for my manager and not getting any room availability because of a convention going on, I finally tried this hotel and the person who answered the phone was very courteous and informed me that rooms were available. After I hung up, I hoped I had made the right decision.
reviews.title: Dirty Sheets...Yuck!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we drove into Aztec looking for a motel and did a double take when we passed the Step Back Inn. Not only is it stepped back a little from the busy road, hence quiet, it is also a step back in time in the way it is presented. Although the building structure seems modern, the decor is tastefully period, with quality furnishings. I actually sampled 3 rooms as the wifi link doesn't reach all the way to the back, but the staff were excellent in the way they put themselves out to get this right for us. Their effort paid off, as we liked it sufficiently to stay for 3 nights rather than the original 1 night stop we had planned.
reviews.title: Characterful and quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All rooms are the same size (large) although some have just one bed. Good quality bathroom (no tubs, just showers). Aircon is reasonably quiet. All 3 rooms I looked at were scrupulously clean, and have a really fresh feel. There is a nice patio above the reception area on which we ate supper one night, as the sun went down over Aztec, and despite this being at the front of the motel, it was pleasant and quiet, and we had a good view of the flower beds out front that give the place some character. There is also a very pleasant lounge room for residents (with piano) that doubles as breakfast room. Next door there is a good chinese restaurant that does nice takeouts, and there are other good eateries adjacent.
reviews.title: Decent for a stay in Aztec

likes.disliked: — Older property (but in pretty good shape)

reviews.text: Nice coffee and juice for breakfast, and the only small criticism I have is that the cinamon roll is a bit limited as breakfast fare - but no complaints as the breakfast is free.
reviews.title: Where the old folks stay!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All desk staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. I'd certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Back after ten years

likes.disliked: — hot water is slow in coming on

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a standard family-run motel with nice rooms and a homey atmosphere. We stayed for one night, and it was fine. Definitely not luxury, but it has all of the amenities of the chain motels and the prices are low. The free continental breakfast was good, room was quiet and staff were friendly. If you want to stay in Aztec instead of Farmington (just down the road), then this inn is certainly suitable. Be advised that there are no upscale restaurants in Aztec, so that might influence whether you stay in Farmington instead.
reviews.title: Great place to stay
